question.questionText: Julie and David each built a solar water heater. Both solar water heaters were 10 centimeters x 10 centimeters x 30 centimeters. Both water heaters were painted black on the inside bottom and filled to the top with 3 liters of room temperature water. Both water heaters were set in the sun. They checked the temperatures every 5 minutes and made the table below. Which box did Julie build, A or B? What evidence supports your answer?

referenceAnswers.referenceAnswer: A. The water in Julie's heater got hotter faster (or had a greater temperature change in 20 minutes). The collector in heater A has the greater surface area so the water in A would get hotter faster than the water in B.

studentAnswers.studentAnswer: B. That they both painted black on the inside in the bottom and filled the top with liters of water. And the heaters will set the sun.
A. When a box has more black than the other it will heat up faster, and hotter.
A. Because Julie's had more black flooring. The more black flooring you get the hotter it gets. Julie's side of the chart had the highest temperature. So box A is hers.
B. Because in B, it is long and it hold more heat.
